dpul.title: Stop text from wrapping around images.
Limit your search should use funnel icon when collapsed

comments.body: @hackartisan can you give me more information here or walk me through what you are describing?

haha, yes this makes absolutely no sense I'm sorry. 

On a narrow-width screen (like a phone view) there's an "expand menu" button at the top right (this icon is known as the hamburger icon because it kind of looks like a hamburger I guess).

Then there's a second hamburger icon above the search results to expand the facet dropdowns. @sdellis's suggestion was to use the "funnel" icon for the facet dropdown use case, so we don't have two hamburgers, and because the facet area is not actually a menu (which is what hamburger icon usually denotes). The funnel is often used do denote narrowing a search.

A funnel icon would look something like https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/filter_1159884?term=funnel&page=1&position=8&page=1&position=8&related_id=1159884&origin=tag (not sure exactly what icon font we use).

Screenshot:
![Screen Shot 2021-10-21 at 9 51 49 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/845363/138292559-d5f576e8-9299-43dd-905d-ea2044cbd44f.png)

dspace-development.title: Document how to remove an object's collection reference

comments.body: Load the JRuby terminal: ``` $ source $HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm $ cd ~/pulibrary-src/dspace-cli $ bin/dspace-irb $eperson Using /dspace Loading jars Loading /dspace/config/dspace.cfg INFO: Loading provided config file: /dspace/config/dspace.cfg INFO: Using dspace provided log configuration (log.init.config) INFO: Loading: /dspace/config/log4j.properties Starting new DSpaceKernel DB jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/dspace_db, UserName=dspace_db_user, PostgreSQL JDBC Driver jruby-9.2.13.0 :001 > ``` In the JRuby terminal: ``` query = DSpace::CLI::Query.new # handle of the object to be updated query.find_by_handle('88435/dsp010k225f00b') first_item = query.results.first # handle of the collection from which the object is to be removed collection_handle = '88435/dsp01c247ds15b' collection = DSpace::CLI::SeniorThesisCollection.find_for_handle(collection_handle) collection.removeItem(first_item) collection.index ``` ### Before running this code: --- ### After running this code: --- ### Another item in this collection with the collection reference remaining after this code has been executed: ---

Note: to ensure that changes take place across DataSpace, after updating the object's collection association, edit the item and update it using the web UI.  If there is a certificate program affiliation using the `pu.certificate` metadata field value, remove it in the web UI and update the item to avoid it getting updated and reindexed later on.

dspace-development.title: Map 2021 Senior Thesis items from certificate programs to their DataSpace collections.

comments.body:
As stated in the linked issue from 2020, the following action run on the server and then at the dspace CLI prompt resolves this issue:

Load the JRuby terminal:
```
$ source $HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm
$ cd ~/pulibrary-src/dspace-cli
$ bin/dspace-irb $eperson
  Using /dspace
  Loading jars
  Loading /dspace/config/dspace.cfg
  INFO: Loading provided config file: /dspace/config/dspace.cfg
  INFO: Using dspace provided log configuration (log.init.config)
  INFO: Loading: /dspace/config/log4j.properties
  Starting new DSpaceKernel
  DB jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/dspace_db, UserName=dspace_db_user,
  PostgreSQL JDBC Driver
  jruby-9.2.13.0 :001 >

```

In the JRuby terminal: 
```
cert_handle = '88435/dsp01c247ds15b'
cert_collection = DSpace::CLI::SeniorThesisCollection.find_for_handle(cert_handle)
query = DSpace::CLI::SeniorThesisCommunity.find_by_class_year('2021')

cert_program = 'Theater Program'
sub_query = query.find_by_certificate_program(cert_program)
collection_handle = '88435/dsp01c247ds15b'
items = []
sub_query.results.each do |item|
  add_to_collection = true
  item.collections.each do |ic|
    add_to_collection = false if ic.handle == collection_handle
  end
  items << item if add_to_collection
end

items.each do |i|
  cert_collection.add_item(i)
  cert_collection.update
end 

cert_collection.index
```
Where `cert_handle` is the certificate program ark to be mapped (consult the table above), the matching `pu.certificate` value from the item's metadata (for example `Theater Program`, `Creative Writing Program`), `collection_handle` is the handle for the DataSpace collection where the item should appear after this code is executed (see table in ticket description above), and the parameter in the call to `find_by_class_year` matching the current year.

I ran this code against the following item, after adjusting the class year to 2021, and adding a `pu.certificate` field instance with the value `Theater Program`: 
https://dataspace-dev.princeton.edu/handle/99999/fk4321d72q

I also adjusted the following item on staging (imported in 2020) to be in the class year 2021, with the `pu.certificate` value of `Theater Program.`:
https://dataspace-staging.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01xw42nb94p

We should be safe to run this on production ASAP.

~~There is a bug in the JRuby code above that will repeatedly add the certificate collection value to the collection field whenever it is executed.  I am looking into fixing this bug now;~~ 

The above-mentioned bug has been resolved in the code sample above.  It is verbose but explicit and does not add duplicate collection values.

In the future we should figure out the best way to remove an item from a collection, which is not possible in the web UI or CLI in this version of DSpace (see #505).

The script was run on three objects in staging and sent to Lynn, excerpt from communication below: 
> Global Health: https://dataspace-staging.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp011g05ff65d
East Asian Studies Program: https://dataspace-staging.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01tt44pq88k
Theater: https://dataspace-staging.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01xw42nb94p

> please bear in mind I altered the class year value to be 2021 and added the certificate program values to map for staging to these, since there were not any 2021 theses already on staging that needed to have the certificate mapping script run; all three of these are from 2020, if you would like to compare them
This is being advanced with https://github.com/pulibrary/symplectic-elements-utils/tree/mssql-docker-migrate/docker, which now permits one to readily perform database backups for the MSSQL server.

pul_solr.title: solr backups not running on solr7 production

comments.body:
@tpendragon investigated, backups are failing on Solr 2/3 because the mounted drive for backups is not owned by the correct user.

All three Solr servers should be capable of running the backups as the leader of the cluster. Fix the current mounting system:
- [x] mount diglibdata1 only once, as `/mnt/solr_backup`
- [ ] use NFS instead of CIFS
- [x] ensure the owner of the `/mnt/solr_backup` directory is the local `deploy` user, which may have a different UID on each box
- [x] update `/etc/fstab` so the new configuration will survive a reboot

I've got 3 of 4 tasks done. I'll wait until we've had a successful backup or two before I try to change the mount from CIFS to NFS. This way if we'll have an easier time determining the cause of any problems we see.
